programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The drop in morale of Churchill's forces following the fall of France to Nazi forces during the Second World War, and how the Dunkirk evacuation and the Battle of Britain helped to restore British confidence. Plus, America's reasons for initially refusing to enter the conflict.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre examines how continued success for the unit could only be achieved with ever more dangerous and ambitious missions, while David Stirling's new second-in-command Captain Paddy Mayne was an officer as unpredictable and dangerous as the phase of war that was about to begin. The historian also reveals how many SAS members were captured by the Germans - and hears the extraordinary story of two of them who outran their pursuers by surviving for three days in the desert without food or fresh water.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: The crimes of Amelia Dyer, who promised mothers that for a fee she would adopt their babies and raise them as her own. In fact, she neglected and murdered countless infants over a 30-year period in Victorian Britain. This episode tells the story of Dyer and of Evelina Marmon, one of the desperate young mothers she deceived.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A devastated cliff-top ruin, an extraordinarily tall tower, a concrete structure stranded at sea and a heavy metal monster in a field all feature.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of plants and animals that live in jungles, one of the hardest environments to thrive in, including strange fungi and creatures that glow in the dark which have never been captured on film before. The programme also includes recordings of caimans and the jaguars that prey on them, freshwater dolphins that swim through flooded forests, undergrowth-dwelling frogs that have to defend themselves against wasps, and the Indri, the world's largest living lemur, which inhabits the forests of Madagascar.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris attempts to cross the length of Cuba, the only island in the Caribbean to boast an extensive railway network, starting in Havana in the west. This proves to be a major challenge given the unreliability of the service and the old trains regularly used, but makes for a fascinating journey to Chris's ultimate goal, the American naval base at Guantanamo Bay. Along the way he soaks up the sights and sounds of Havana, retraces the footsteps of the country's national hero Che Guevara, and visits the ghost town of Camilo Cienfuegos - a relic from Cuba's colonial sugar plantation era.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: A polar bear hunts with her cubs, while the warmer weather of spring accelerates a process that will eventually see an area of ice the size of Australia disappear into the Arctic Ocean. A woolly bear caterpillar emerges from the snow after spending the winter frozen, and in Antarctica male Adelie penguins arrive to begin constructing nests in fierce storms as they try to attract mates.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of animals that live in the desert, including a pride of desert lions that risks hunting a giraffe several times their size. The film also features an immense swarm of locusts, sand grouse flying for 120 miles to gather water for their offspring, and an unprecedented recording of a tiny bat defending itself against one of the world's deadliest scorpions.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Experts analyse the work of engineers including Sir Nigel Gresley, who engineered the world's fastest steam train in 1938 and Eric Laithwaite, whose linear motor made frictionless travel a possibility. These innovators influenced the engineering of the Shanghai Maglev, the fastest passenger train in operation on Earth, which broke numerous engineering boundaries in its construction. Held in place by a series of electromagnets, it levitates on an air gap of 10mm and is able to reach a top speed of 431kms per hour.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: The story of the siege of Kohima in 1944, when heavily outnumbered British and Indian troops held off Japanese forces until reinforcements could arrive.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey describes how Winston Churchill drew on the lessons of his ancestor John to lead the UK through the Second World War. At two key moments, the prime minister's strategic sense helped avert disaster, and in both decisions, the influence of the Duke of Marlborough is apparent. Starkey argues that it was Winston's ability to control events by giving them a narrative meaning that enabled him to shape world history long after his fall from power.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on an expedition along Dorset's Jurassic coast to explore the county's hidden Second World War story. Starting beside the defences on Chesil Beach, he heads east to finish in Swanage and Studland Bay. On his five-day walk he encounters stunning scenery and uncovers wartime acts of ingenuity and bravery. He also discovers the crucial part a swannery played in developing a secret weapon and reveals the role of Dorset in protecting Britain from invasion during the conflict.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris takes a railway trip across Canada, revealing how 2,500 miles of transcontinental railway was built against huge odds in just a few decades, helping to join together a vast wilderness of isolated communities and create the country that exists today. He begins his journey on one of the earliest sections of track to be built, on a train that is now a lifeline for hunters and fishermen. He then sees one of the biggest, most famous trains in the world - the Canadian, before heading for the Prairies, and on to the port of Vancouver. Along the way he also searches for Winnie the Pooh, crosses raging rivers and meets the descendant of a pioneering Yorkshire family who arrived here more than 100 years ago.

He discovers how austerity and fears of congestion led to European disasters in the shape of Britain's infamous three-wheelers, French death traps and German absurdities, and also takes to the battlefield to settle one of the greatest rivalries in car history.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the life and work of people in the polar regions, including the residents of Norilsk in Siberia, the coldest city on Earth. He also discovers how the Danish armed forces maintain their country's claim to Greenland's natural resources by mounting a 2,000-mile dog sled patrol during the winter, and finds out how a research base at the South Pole is able to cope with being cut off from the outside world for six months at a time.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Camera crews journey to the deepest parts of the world's oceans to explore the lives of their inhabitants, including fearsome predators with huge teeth, strange jellyfish and deep-sea sharks that lurk among the gigantic submerged mountains and volcanos. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Three Gorges Dam, built across China's Yangtze river, which is the largest and heaviest concrete structure ever built, housing the world's largest power station.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: A Scottish soldier who walked 200 miles through the Libyan desert without water or supplies recalls Ronald Moore, the leader of his party.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How the myth of German invincibility was finally debunked by their defeat at the Battle of Stalingrad. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A towering structure with an explosive past, a deserted cityscape, a mysterious top-secret facility and a vast Nazi construction.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Stratolaunch is designed to lift rockets, spacecraft and experimental high-speed hypersonic planes into the stratosphere, then release them for their onward journey into space.

programme.title: Porridge

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch desperately wants to get out of the tedious task of making fishing nets, and hatches a crafty scheme to get himself assigned to the library. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.

programme.title: Blackadder

programme.title: Blackadder

programme.title: The World at War

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson goes on a four-day trek through the Kintail region of the north-western Highlands, examining the story of the Jacobite uprisings of the early 1700s along the way. He starts by visiting Iron Age dwellings in Shiel Bridge, and heads to the rebuilt castle on Eilean Donan, the original of which was destroyed after invading Spanish troops landed there and were attacked by British warships. Tony ends in Glen Shiel, the site of a climactic battle in 1719 where royalist troops defeated the rebels.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: It was 30 years after the Romans invaded Britain that they were ready to take on the challenge of conquering the Lake District. With the toughest landscape they had encountered in the nation, peopled by a rebellious tribe, it was no small task, but within a few years, the whole of Lakeland was under their control. Tony Robinson tackles the journey by himself, walking 50 miles from Penrith to Ambleside and on to the Irish Sea at Ravenglass, discovering that the Romans encountered beauty and danger in equal measure.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson takes a four-day trek along the coastline between Plymouth in Devon and Falmouth, learning about the thriving smuggling trade in Cornwall during the late 18th century. The area's tiny secretive harbours, beaches and secluded coves were ideal for illicit imports such as tobacco and brandy, and the business was so huge it threatened the national economy. Along his route, visiting such beauty spots as Lantic Bay and Polperro, he encounters all sorts of reminders of the trade and meets descendants of those involved.

programme.title: Royal Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Calls to reinvestigate the suspicious death of King Ludwig of Bavaria in 1886, who died three days after he was declared insane and deposed from the throne.

programme.title: The Blue Planet

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: James concludes his examination of the social significance of cars by exploring how aspiration and new wealth were behind the development of some of the greatest models ever made. He tries to make sense of the baffling world of company car hierarchy by holding a travelling salesman race-off and indulges his 1980s urges with the twin delights of a Lamborghini and a Porsche. He also unveils his choice of the ultimate people's car - a vehicle that can lay claim to being the greatest in history.

programme.title: Madagascar
programme.desc: David Attenborough narrates the story of the island in the Indian Ocean, off the southeastern coast of Africa. It has an ecosystem that has stood in isolation for millions of years, and produced an array of wildlife that cannot be found anywhere else on the planet. He begins by observing lemurs in their habitat, male red giraffe-necked weevils fighting each other, the courting rituals of chameleons, and the behaviour of spiders and fossas.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Predators and prey in the open oceans come under the scrutiny of David Attenborough. Marlin track down a shoal of sardines as a sei whale scoops up the leftovers, dolphins herd mackerel and attract the attention of a sailfish with the resonance of their sonar, and giant sunfish queue up to allow other species, including seagulls, to feed on their parasites.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Millau Viaduct in South West France, which is the tallest bridge in the world and stretches two and a half kilometres over one of Europe's deepest valleys.

programme.desc: The dealer recruits con artists Matron Jackie, Gideon and Henry the Hearse Chaser to attend an auction where he is selling a painting, to purposely bid against each other to bump up the price. programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Anna and Gino's romance continues to blossom as they sneak off to spend time together - even though it's clear that something about their secret trysts is playing on Gino's mind. Meanwhile, at Ash Park, Olivia and James's relationship is at breaking point as Olivia struggles with the identity of James's lover. Romantic drama, starring Marta Dusseldorp.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Terry appears in court to testify against brother Ben, but reacts badly to being questioned about his own childhood abuse, indirectly jeopardising the outcome of the trial. Phil begins to realise he is powerless to stop former lover Christine emigrating with their daughter Madison, while Smithy spends the night with sultry Louise Larson, unaware Zain Nadir is investigating the criminal activities of her husband Pete.

Nick tries to get Diane on his side by letting her perform a difficult procedure for the first time, while Ric talks her into taking the research position full time. Kyla brings Max to work as he is a diabetic and she is worried about his blood sugar levels.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: The atmosphere is tense between new nurse Barney Wolfe and Adam as they fail to see eye to eye. Two serious cases of food poisoning panic one unfortunate fellow, who rushes home to check on his son, only to discover that his wife is having an affair, and Duffy begins to feel the pressures of her new responsibilities. Derek Thompson, Cathy Shipton and Ian Bleasdale star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Anita Dobson guests as Phil Hunter's mum Lynne, who turns up at the station to lecture him on his responsibilities as a father-to-be. Smithy seizes an opportunity to meet local villain's wife Louise Larson and continue their dangerous relationship, while Adam struggles to make headway with his road safety campaign, until old friend Isaac Collins pulls a few strings at the local council to help get it under way. In court, the case against Terry's brother Ben concludes - but the outcome promises to have a devastating long-term effect on the entire family.

programme.desc: Shelley's ready to be more than friends with Mark. Pauline's determined to find out about Pete's disappearance. Gita warns Cindy about Richard.

Molly attempts to avoid a weekend trip with Andrew, fearing she is not ready for a new romance, and Golly is reunited with his estranged daughter Jess.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: The nurses get more than they bargained for as they prepare for a darts match in the Skelthwaite Arms, and Beth has a surprise visitor. Drama, starring Lesley Dunlop and Leslie Ash.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: The Boswell family try to cope without Nellie, who has some surprise visitors - her 'fancy man' Derek and Lilo Lill.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: It is a day of discontent at Maplin's when the pay packets arrive, and Ted and Spike act out the French Revolution in the swimming pool. Comedy, starring Paul Shane, David Griffin and Ruth Madoc.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean and Lionel settle down to enjoy a quiet evening, only to find themselves constantly disturbed by ominous noises from the empty house next door. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The detective duo are called to a hospital, where a series of suspicious deaths has raised fears a serial killer may be at work on the wards. A grisly collection of body parts is found in a nearby lake, and both patients and staff are dropping dead with alarming regularity. However, Pascoe soon finds his own health is as much of a worry as the case itself. Robert Powell, Miriam Karlin and Haydn Gwynne guest star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Fresh DNA tests on an unidentified body found in 1996 reveal a family link to a Home Office fingerprint analyst, who has not seen her brother since she was seven, when he brought her over to the UK from their home country of Albania. The victim had been working as a police interpreter - and the motive seems clear when it turns out his last assignment was translating for a witness in a murder trial against a notorious Albanian criminal. Meanwhile, Gerry embarks on a French cookery course, but the language barrier results in a rather surprising date. Amanda Redman and Dennis Waterman star.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Eve links DNA evidence found at a traffic collision to a murder case she worked on while examining mass graves during the Balkan War, leaving Boyd determined to track down the perpetrators, a ring of war criminals now living and working in the UK. Starring Trevor Eve and Sue Johnston, with guest stars Ron Cook, Anna Madeley and Branka Katic.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Elizabeth is rushed to hospital after suffering a heart attack, and is looked after tenderly by Jack, but comes close to revealing a secret from her past while heavily sedated. Sam uncovers a family secret when he treats a boy who is undergoing a heart transplant.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Sean asks Max to put in a good word for him with Tina, but the result is totally unexpected. Holly befriends a little boy caught in the crossfire of marital breakdown, and a pensioner with a fractured neck sparks recriminations between her husband and son. Gerald Kyd and Claire Goose star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: A Small Price to Pay - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of three. Gina returns to her job immediately after receiving treatment for her cancer. Clearly unfit for work but too stubborn to admit it, she relies on June to oversee the relief. Gary is shot during a raid on a gang suspected of handling stolen goods, while Phil bristles with righteous indignation at the discovery that Kate has been mugged at knifepoint and vows to catch the thug responsible. As for Adam, he hits another snag as he tries to get his road safety initiative up and running, and again asks Isaac Collins to help - unaware his old friend's shady past is about to catch up with him.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Cindy is going to the restaurant with Richard. Kath is fed up with Arthur and Mrs Hewitt. Dot visits her grandson. Gita tells her sister she has to go.

programme.desc: Cindy confesses to Ian that she has been out with Richard. Dot visits her grandson Ashley.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The Blue Watch boys tackle two different, but equally dangerous and challenging blazes, one at a car-breaker's yard, the other in a Chinese restaurant.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Dorothy announces her plans to build an eco-dome, but Lexie is suspicious of her motives - and when it is revealed the proposed access road runs through the newly established outdoor activity centre, relations break down between Paul and Archie. Meanwhile, Duncan relishes his new job but discovers Hermione has lied to him, and Jess accuses Golly of being sexist when she fails to get the head ranger's job.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: David puts his money worries aside to captain the local cricket team in a grudge match against their rivals _ but is the game up for the bungling businessman? Hussan uses a cheap trick to try to win Jess back, while Anna refuses to let Simon help her with the baby, determined to go it alone, but finds comfort in sharing her woes with young mum Marie Briggs, who is also struggling to cope with the pressures of single parenthood. Small-town drama, starring Lesley Dunlop and Philip Middlemiss.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Nellie, newly released from hospital, meets the family at the Victorian mansion for their holiday - but things aren't exactly relaxing.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Gladys agrees to marry Clive - much to his family's dismay. Comedy, starring Ruth Madoc.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean begins to think that, 19 months after tying the knot, her marriage may have become stale. She wonders whether a few surprises from Lionel would spice things up, so Alistair, helped by Judith and Sandy, comes up with a plan to give her the treat of a lifetime.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Cyril Blamire leaves to live in Oswestry, after hearing a lady he is interested in has become a widow. However, his old friend Foggy Dewhurst arrives in the village, and soon makes his presence known to the locals. Brian Wilde stars.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: The judge hears the case of three men accused of shooting a rival gang member - but the trial is in danger of collapsing when the prosecution's main witness is killed in a hit-and-run incident. To make matters worse, the jurors start to fall sick, and the newly appointed Home Secretary sees a chance to make it into a jury-less trial - which could force Deed to throw it out altogether. Martin Shaw stars, with Jenny Seagrove.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: New information links the unexplained death of a market trader to a series of drug rapes in east London - but with that case still ongoing, Ucos officers are unable to question the chief suspect, so they have to look into their victim's past in their search for clues. Gerry finds a likely culprit in the shape of the market inspector who clamped his car, while Sandra has problems of a more personal nature when her hated mother arrives for a visit. Sheila Hancock guest stars.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. After a naked woman is found fleeing a car accident, she is taken to hospital and tests reveal her DNA is linked to a double murder in 1960s Soho. Boyd discovers the victim, successful entrepreneur Elizabeth Andrews, has suffered a horrific attack at the hands of her abductors and he is led to her home, where a man presumed to be her husband is found hanged in the hallway. With a new murder as well as the cold case to solve, the team tries to connect the crimes, but a greater danger awaits Elizabeth in hospital. Drama, starring Trevor Eve and his real-life wife Sharon Maughan.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: George is asked to host a Japanese trade delegation on the eve of Remembrance Day. Knowing how the community will react, he asks Jack to come to the reception in the hope that the approval of a former Japanese prisoner of war might help deal with any ill feeling. At the event Regina is openly hostile toward Sarah, which she attributes to anti-Semitism. Anna's prolonged absence from Ash Park has Gino fearing that their relationship is over, but he is unaware that she is with Caroline awaiting the results of a pregnancy test. Meanwhile, James and Olivia continue to grow closer. Romantic drama, starring Marta Dusseldorp.

Smithy and Jonathan call at Gina's house to see why she hasn't turned up for work, and discover her unconscious on the bathroom floor. Away from the line of duty, Tony feels dejected at not having a date for Honey's birthday party and decides to hire an escort for the evening - little anticipating the surprise awaiting him.

Alastair Mackenzie and Susan Hampshire star.

programme.desc: Tom Beresford returns to Skelthwaite 20 years after a bitter family row, lured by the offer of a managerial position at Goddard's, and it's not long before he and his good-looking son are setting tongues wagging. Karen breaks all the rules to help two families come to terms with the consequences of a transplant operation, but her ill-advised actions backfire. Vic decides the time has come for a younger man to captain the Scorpions and an emotional Simon proposes to Anna. Drama, starring Tony Haygarth, Lesley Dunlop and Leslie Ash.

programme.desc: Connie and Oswald join the holiday to see Billy and Aveline, and Joey's protest about the game shooting on the estate wins him an admirer.

programme.desc: Bacchus and Gently investigate a consignment of stolen passports, but the case takes an unexpected turn when a woman linked to the crime is found dead on the seashore with her mixed-race baby lying next to her. As the duo follow a lead on the murder victim's ex-boyfriend, they encounter racial prejudice and are drawn into an underground world of gang wars within the Arab community. Primeval's Andrew-Lee Potts guest stars.

programme.desc: The ex-coppers find themselves under the microscope when a psychologist arrives to conduct a study into older men in the workplace - but she soon reveals a more personal reason for her visit. It turns out that five years ago her brother, a cycle courier, was the victim of a hit-and-run that left him unable to recall anything prior to the incident. Now he says he was targeted for the parcel he was carrying, which was stolen at the scene - or so he believes. Sally Phillips guest stars.

Drama, starring Trevor Eve, with Ian Mercer, Michelle Dockery and Rory Kinnear.

programme.desc: Vic makes a shock announcement about his future, Tom proves his worth in a crunch match for the Scorpions and Karen and Beth help reunite an estranged family after a baby girl goes missing. Drama, starring Leslie Ash and Kerrie Taylor.

programme.desc: The detective investigates a suspicious death in an army barracks, aided by Joe and an enthusiastic member of the military police. Although the demise of commanding officer Dev initially looks like suicide, a case for murder is quickly established and the team's first task is to find a motive. Sensing a connection to Ollie, a soldier killed in Afghanistan, Vera interviews the victim's loyal comrades and Ollie's grieving family, discovering a traumatic event that nobody wants to talk about. John Duttine (Heartbeat) guest stars alongside Brenda Blethyn, David Leon, Jon Morrison and Paul Ritter.

She also opens up about her role as an animal rights activist, including persuading Vladimir Putin to ban the import of seal products into Russia.

programme.desc: The chef is joined by Paul Ainsworth to explore the culinary delights of Dorset, with the pair going aboard a millionaire's yacht, where James cooks a sea bass dish. Paul samples local cheeses, while James visits a breeder with Mangalitsa pigs in a beautiful coastline setting.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott's tour of Sardinia continues in the Nuoro region, where his guide Claudio takes him to meet his parents, who run a small bakery specialising in pane carasau, a thin crispy bread found all over the island. Claudio then takes the chef to his family's citrus farm to discover local fruit the pompia, a citrus so bitter it is never eaten raw but makes a fabulous liqueur. Moving up to the hills, Ainsley cooks a traditional sheep stew with a group of shepherds, visits one of the island's ancient archaeological sites and cooks up a Sardinian-style minestrone.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team heads to the Yorkshire Dales to surprise Jim Thompson, a terminally ill 65-year-old grandfather and fundraiser. Despite Jim's own diagnosis, his commitment to spreading awareness and raising money for prostate cancer charities are legendary in the area, including creating a 'Calendar Girls' style naked calendar. Inspired by his bravery and dedication, the makeover team decide to turn Jim's overgrown and dangerous plot into a classic cottage garden with a Yorkshire twist.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A planning dispute leads to murder after a stalwart in the Midsomer Conservation Society suspects her neighbours are involved in a money-making development scam. Guest starring Hugo Speer (Bleak House), with John Nettles, Jason Hughes and Jane Wymark.

Hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK.

Throughout the show he prepares flat breads with tomato salsa, barbecue corn on the cob with local spice spicy ras el hanout and whole fish with chermoula.

programme.desc: The team members are hit hard by a life-or-death emergency, forcing Gabriel to face his true feelings. Lydia's determination to help Jyoti get better comes at a great personal cost to the doctor. Ted seeks closure as he prepares to leave India. Medical drama, starring Amanda Redman, James Krishna Floyd, Kenneth Cranham and Sayani Gupta.

programme.title: Belgravia
programme.desc: The conclusion of Julian Fellowes' drama about secrets and lies in uptight 19th-century London society. James travels to Manchester to investigate the allegations made against Charles, but soon realises there are greater threats at play. Lady Templemore employs Reggie to make Lady Maria change her mind, but her daughter will not give in so easily. Susan is in danger of losing everything after her secret is revealed, but as ever she uses her cunning to twist the situation to her own and others' benefit, while Charles is puzzled to receive a mysterious olive branch. Keen to end the feuding, he seeks out the offer of reconciliation - unaware he is being lured into danger.

programme.title: Exposure
programme.desc: Jonathan Maitland presents an undercover report on the fast-growing sport of white-collar boxing, whereby people with little or no experience of fighting train to appear in special bouts, often for charity. Two undercover reporters attend training sessions at gyms in Leeds and London to find out how safe it is for those who take part.

programme.title: Ross Kemp: On the NHS Frontline
programme.desc: First of two programmes in which Ross Kemp follows frontline medical staff in Milton Keynes Hospital Trust as they prepare for and face the coronavirus pandemic. He witnesses the sacrifices staff and their families are making in their battle against the disease. And he follows the journey of patients admitted into the hospital's respiratory ward with mild symptoms, through to the intensive care units, where those with severe Covid-19 fight for their lives.

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers. Highlights include a man accidentally throwing a hammer through his patio door, a young couple interrupted during a romantic proposal and a woman in labour who decides to play a prank on her midwife.

They start out by sampling the latest trends of using cannabis in cooking, which was legalised in California in 2018 - but as they enjoy a hippy afternoon tea, Gino overindulges and chaos ensues, especially when the next activity on the agenda is a session of goat yoga. Moving on, the trio dig for clams on the Pacific coast, take a hot-air ride to a vineyard and visit a factory in Chinatown where fortune cookies are made. It seems a competition is in order and so the travel companions see who can make the most cookies in 60 seconds.

programme.desc: James is joined by Clare Smyth for a tour of the Lake District. They visit the Windermere Jetty Museum and take a trip on the lake in a traditional steam-powered boat. They also visit the farmers who supply the meat for Clare's restaurant and discover the secrets behind the region's famous sticky toffee pudding.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five contestants calling themselves 'The Virtual Friends' answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Martin's GMC report requires he passes three refresher courses which will then decide whether he is deemed fit to practice, starting with phlebotomy. Meanwhile, Louisa focuses on her new career as a child and adolescent counsellor. Much to Bert's dismay, Al hires Caitlin, and confesses to his accidental proposal.

programme.title: A Very British Lockdown: Diaries from the Frontline
programme.desc: Documentary featuring a wide cross-section of people as they record their own stories on camera phones - charting the everyday courage, kindness, anxiety and humour they experience as the nation strives to 'Keep Calm and Carry On'. From shopkeepers to home-schooling parents, care workers to cleaners, teachers to nurses, the film reveals what HM The Queen recently called 'our quiet, good humoured resolve'. Others - such as expectant Mums and the sick and elderly - show their bravery in the face of the coronavirus.

programme.title: A Mother's Son
programme.desc: Concluding the two-part drama, starring Hermione Norris, Martin Clunes, Paul McGann and Alexander Arnold. In the aftermath of the murder and the discovery of the bloodstained trainers, Rosie's distress starts to affect her family life and cracks begin to form. Meanwhile, David has learnt their son Jamie has been mixing with violent dropout Sean and fears he may have fallen under his influence.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Home Alone with Joel Dommett
programme.desc: The comedian hosts a special programme from his own home, featuring celebrity call-ins to comedy interviews and games with fellow self-isolated viewers.

programme.title: Kate & Koji
programme.desc: When Kate's flashy ex-husband Dennis arrives in town with his much younger wife, Kate feigns an attachment to Koji. Councillor Bone is sure their relationship is a front, but that does not stop a good old-fashioned show down at the pub. Comedy, starring Brenda Blethyn, Jimmy Akingbola and Barbara Flynn.

programme.title: Belgravia
programme.desc: The conclusion of Julian Fellowes' drama about secrets and lies in uptight 19th-century London society. James travels to Manchester to investigate the allegations made against Charles, but soon realises there are greater threats at play. Lady Templemore employs Reggie to make Lady Maria change her mind, but her daughter will not give in so easily. Susan is in danger of losing of losing everything after he secret is revealed, but as ever she used her cunning to twist the situation to her own and others' benefit, while Charles is puzzled to receive a mysterious olive branch. Keen to end the feuding, he seeks out the offer of reconciliation - unaware he is being lured into danger.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Barging Round Britain with John Sergeant
programme.desc: The broadcaster takes in the delights of the Lancaster Canal, setting out from Tewitfield. As he meanders down the waterway, John cannot resist visiting Carnforth railway station, where he re-enacts his favourite scene from the classic film Brief Encounter, some of which was filmed there. After Carnforth, the canal crosses the River Lune on its way to Lancaster, where the veteran journalist marvels at the engineering of the Lune Aqueduct. Later, he heads south to Garstang, famous for its cheeses, and finally on towards Preston.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: Paul meets a hyperactive staffie called Cookie, who training staff believe could make an excellent working dog, but this is not usual for staffies, so finding someone to take him on may be difficult. Paul also meets a two-year-old Dogue de Bordeaux in need of some love after being found abandoned in a park, and nine-month-old teacup poodle Charlie is having trouble running with her broken leg. Head vet Shaun explains that Charlie has three breaks on one leg, and the best thing for her is going to be to remove it.

programme.title: Our Queen at War
programme.desc: How the life of the young Princess Elizabeth was shaped by the events of the Second World War, and the extraordinary experiences she went through during her teenage years. The film draws on archive material and interviews with people who shared her experiences, and royal experts explore how she was transformed from a shy princess into Queen Elizabeth II and Britain's longest reigning monarch.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: As Britain and Europe remain locked down in the fight against Covid-19, Julie Etchingham asks how seriously the food supply chain is being affected. Crops will be ready to be harvested in the coming weeks, but there may be no labour available. She looks at how shops, supermarkets and delivery services are coping now the early panic buying is over. And she asks, if vulnerable families cannot get access to food at prices they can afford, will people ultimately be forced to change the way they eat?.

programme.title: Gordon, Gino and Fred: American Road Trip
programme.desc: For the final leg of their US jaunt, the trio arrive in Texas, a meat-lover's paradise where Gordon Ramsay is keen to introduce his companions to some of the best barbecue food known to man. In Lexington, Gordon turns lumberjack in an attempt to fell a dead oak - which is used to infuse ovens with wood smoke. There's a break for a bit of skinny dipping, before the trio fish go fishing, and stay in a strange cabin deep in the woods, surviving on beans and bourbon. They then hit the state capital of Austin, dressing as cowboys in the local bar and at the rodeo, before one last barbecue supper of slow-smoked beef brisket, pork ribs and spicy sausage.
